HELP! I need some clarification;
 
Sanmai tsuba are tsuba made using three =
layers of metal held together by a fukurin. The word 'sanmai' does not desi=
gnate a school or group, correct? 
Kinko (Kinku) means metal worker. Ko-kin=
ko is 'early' metal worker? Tsubako is tsuba maker.
Kagamishi - Is this a s=
chool (Ha) or metal worker? Do they or him make Sanmai tsuba? Is this relat=
ed to the Kaga Ha?

I have Ko-kinko tsuba, Sanmai tsuba, and one Kagamishi =
made tsuba. They all are made of three layers, held by fukurin. There is zo=
gan on some, and all have some design formed by a substance under the outsi=
de layer of metal. How do you tell one from the other????

I appreciate the=
 time and education that you (all) give me.

Elliott
